positive.review:
Review of Kingdom Rush 5: Alliance TD 6/10
Overall it has been a good experience to play this game. Personally I have been very hyped and excited for this installment and I did unfortunately not find that it lived up to my expectations.
The theme of an alliance of good and evil, and of having two heroes is unfortunately not explored very thoroughly.

If you are looking for a Kingdom Rush game this is it. If you are looking for THE Kingdom Rush game, this is not it.

Main campaign 6/10
The main campaign felt very short with only 3 areas, I would love for it to have had a 4th area or more.
The levels have been somewhat polarizing, some levels were awesome, requiring me to think about what I had to change about my strategy to complete it. On the other hand, some levels were just boring, and at times unpleasant to play.

The first area was very beautiful and well crafted, I liked the thematic and the difficulty.

Aesthetically the second area was only decent, however the difficulty was very fun! I had to spend time to adjust my strategy, and think about what towers and upgrades I wanted to bring to the battlefield.

Personally the last area was thematically uninteresting. The maps were annoying to play because of the ”eye” mechanic of the maps, healing and buffing the enemy units. It felt very uninteractive to play against since there was not much I could do to prevent it. On some maps there is an opportunity to fight the enemies before and after but it does not matter that much. Also the last 3 levels i just spammed the eldritch channeler and found it to be the most effective :(

Heroes 4/10
The heroes are for me mostly quite uninteresting. The whole idea behind having two heroes is for them to be strong and interact a lot with the levels. Yes, that did happen, but I only ever seemed to find myself using Raelyn + Someone else.

I recommend playing some of the previous KR games before this one because even though the learning curve it's not hard, IMO it's more pleasant to enjoy the new features of this game. Other than that, there's not much more to say if you like these games

The newest Kingdom Rush game. It's pretty fun, I just wish their were more tanky heroes. There's only 2 in the game and every other hero in the game is a damage or utility hero. Also gold flow during levels feels lower than the other Kingdom Rush games. Still really fun though. The Iron challenges are way too easy though.
Awesome pictures, fun to play with my kids watching on big screen.

I am a long time fan of Kingdom Rush games and own all of them on multiple platforms, I have not purchased the DLC yet but this is my favorite Kingdom Rush game so far. I love the diversity in towers and heroes. I suggest it if you enjoy tower defense games.
Fun maps. Very cool tower mechanic where you can select from a wide variety for each map with new towers unlocking  over time.
Fun but difficult game. Buy on sale only

Every time a new Kingdom Rush drops, I buy it on first week and beat it right away.

I think that pretty much says everything about how amazing this series is.

I've been playing the Kingdom Rush series since OG..seen the progress and Alliance really shows the development of its fun so far! From 1 to 2 player-controlled heroes, tower development, story and of course the fun references scattered throughout each game! Definitely a must-play for me :)

The Wukong's Journey DLC contains the best designed levels in the game so far. The Element Holders add another level of strategy, because they are often not in optimal positions so you must decide if it is worth the bonus. The challenge variants of the levels are tight and difficult on Impossible. Very fun. One of my gripes is that the Fire Element Holder does not seem to buff tower units, which it does not specify in the description. Could be wrong.

I discovered this game thanks to your beta tester Thokrumgrozo, and I have to admit that it’s really very addictive. I like both the gameplay and the level design — it’s simply an amazing game and everyone should play it, though only if you have a lot of free time, because once you start, the game won’t let you leave your computer.

So this franchise is great, its always been great. I've been playing it since it was a browser game. The game play formula has been surprisingly consistent over the years. Evolving slightly between titles, without the developers trying to change genres, or steer the franchise in a contrived way.  

I've noticed some disappointment from long term fans with the last two releases. I think the issue is that a base game comes out. Then for a year or two dlc trickles out for it. When its all said and done, you have solid memories of that game and its DLC combined. When the next game comes out without the DLC that will eventually define half of its buik and character, it feels lightweight and half assed.

Its an illusory sadness that the developer cant really fix, and it goes away if the player sticks it out and sees it through.

For my money, all five games are great. They all basically came out to three hours of entertainment per dollar spent, and story wise, I'm kind of interested to see what they do next.

Probably my least favorite in the franchise and actually made me appreciate both Origins and Vengeance more.  Originally I was disappointed in Origins because it felt like it deviated from the first two games too much, but now with this release, I realize it was closer to them than I had thought. Vengeance felt like a true deviation from the original formula and yet it completely stuck the landing. The theme of the game, the customization, its overall charm - the Kingdom Rush magic was there. And I feel like it's not with this new installment.

I can't tell what the theme of this game is at all. It's like a mishmash of everything which makes it so that there's nothing to define it by. Like someone was cooking a soup and just threw in everything because they thought it would make it better but it just really made it come out bad. 

The heroes, the towers...I wouldn't necessarily say they are bad as they are quite a few that I like (especially with the new Wu Kong DLC), but the options this time around feel like bloat. Vengeance, despite having the same formula as this game, didn't feel that way. Everything felt fun, distinct, and charming. Some of the towers and heroes in this game are just flat out not appealing, and not in a meta/damage output way, but just overall design/fun to play way. I don't want to play with them. There's too many toys here that just aren't fun.

Map and wave design is just bad. This is probably my biggest gripe with the game. Maps just look bad, are designed poorly, and waves feel like they are very easy until maybe the last 3 waves of the last 3 levels of the main campaign, where the difficulty just shoots up tremendously out of nowhere. I always thought Kingdom Rush was a cut above the rest of every other Tower Defense game because each wave brought a nice, smooth progression in difficulty/enemy units, unlike other games where it felt like the waves are easy until the final 20 seconds of the last wave where it feels like you are suddenly bombed with enemy units that rush in out of nowhere. This game unfortunately has that now, especially with some of the damn flying units .

Enemy units just blow. Again with the other games, there is a distinct theme about them that makes it both charming and intuitive. Intuitive in the sense that I know if I see say an armored looking unit, then I know, "okay, he has physical damage mitigation and I should place a magic tower to counter him". This runs true as well when I see a mage looking guy. But this game, with it complete lack of distinct theme and mishmash of everything, I find myself just confused on what the enemy unit is and what it exactly does. I even will have just read the fact card about it that pops up, and then forget a few waves later after I read 3 more fact cards about 3 new enemies.

Charm is no longer here in this game. There's no more humor. No more iconic one liners, "TOOOOOOO BATTLE!". With its extremely vibrant, animated design and colors, lack of theme, and lack of that classic Ironhide humor, this game feels soulless. 

Now, having said all that, there's still plenty I like about this game:

-It's a Kingdom Rush game

-Having two heroes is pretty fun (though I do miss meteor barrage/lightning/magic as those were super satisfying to nuke a wave with)

Shit... not much else. This is an off-the-cuff, stream of consciousness review so as I was writing out the pros of this game nothing comes out besides those two. The other games in this franchise are just better, in virtually all ways. 

Having said all this, I still recommend getting this game if you are fan of the series and my opinion on this game will likely change in the future like it did for Origins. I will probably appreciate the game more in the future as I sink more hours into it, more DLC comes out for it (Sun Wukong has been pretty hype so far), and I revisit it with fresh eyes.

A great game! I'd rate it as the third best in the series after the first two. It's more of a challenge than Vengeance, and yet there are still a lot of feasible setups for which tower to use on any given stage.

negative.review:
As someone who grew up with Kingdom rush from a young young age playing it as a flash game with my grandad. this game is simply not the same, I like the core concept but there are a few issue that ruin that kind of vibe the old kingdom rush gave. 

1. there arent really unique enemies per zone that force you to consider what Towers youre using, you can kind of just spam the same few towers and win the game easily. you dont have to go into a mission and carefully consider what towers youre bringing which to a degree I get because it would be boring to go in a mission just to learn the monsters on the waves and then restart with the right tower but this is why the first kingdom rush games were so good. The base towers all served a role and they could specialise on the go allowing you to assess the situation and make the right choice.

2. Towers lack much personality, unlike older games where every tower had multiple specialisations making it fun to mess around and find out which build for that tower is the best, the towers in this game are static with the same upgrades every time and I understand this game is trying to have many new towers instead of a few with many specialisations but it just makes all the towers boring. there is no variety, you can only do one thing with those towers,

Kinda disappointed on a number of levels. This isn't the first version of this game I've played, and I have played quite a few TD games. 

 There's a lot of variety on towers and champions to play and that's cool. But some are just wildly stronger than others. It means you can just spam one tower on basically every level and win. 

Same with heroes. Ranged are just massively stronger than melee, and flying is even stronger than that since they don't die. Also Melee is handicapped since it's much harder for them to gain XP. 

So now you have a very clear meta on how to win and it's boring. Now let's add to that: there's no speed controls in the game so it's stuck going very slow. Also you can't window the screen, so if you want to alt+tab to something else while you wait, you can't. 

Lastly, and maybe this is only a thing for me: You can't just escape> quit. You are forced to go to the main menu and then quit. It's 2025, it's not hard to code this. Esc> exit game on every game forever, this is a cardinal rule of gaming. 

This is one of those mobile time wasters, whatever. Not worth the price on PC, that's for sure. Maybe if it goes on sale for $5.

Other reviews said it better so I'll keep it short. Its a 6/10 not worth the money. It lacks content and innovation and is no better then the previous games, arguably worse in multiple aspects. Its DLC's do not fix the core problems with its design, gold based difficulty, bosses instantly destroying or disabling towers, etc. They do add more content which this game is notably lacking but also increase the price which is already too high. If you want to play Kingdom Rush the previous four games are better, only play this one if you liked the previous games and want more of the series and even then only get this game with its DLC's and on sale. If Steam had a neutral review id select it over negative.
This game is so friggin boring, I can't bring myself to play it. I used to loved the past entries so it figured out I might like this one as well.

I’ve been thinking for a long time about what rating to give this game… I decided to replay the levels from the free DLCs, and the answer came by itself: I’m tired of this unoptimized, untested mess disguised at hard and insane difficulty.

As a fan of the first two games - Kingdom Rush (630 hours played) and Kingdom Rush Frontiers (430 hours played), I can say with confidence – this is a poorly balanced casual grind-fest designed to milk players with paid DLC. I didn’t want to buy the fifth part, but it was gifted to me :)

Let’s quickly go over the main aspects: graphics are nice, the artists do their job well. Sound and music are fine. Controls are smooth and responsive. But gameplay, balance, and replayability – that’s where everything falls apart.

Main game: you basically have two ways of playing.
--- The hard way: set the game to high difficulty, clear each mission, then heroic and iron challenges, level up all heroes. You sweat, you replay levels, sometimes even have fun, and once the boomerang tower that generates gold appears, the game becomes way too easy.
--- The easy way: even on high difficulty you just yawn through the whole campaign, maybe do heroic and iron if you feel like it (or skip them entirely). Boring.

Free DLCs: These are something beyond good and evil, especially the swamp levels. Monsters that make some towers completely useless. Bugs where tanky enemies don’t take damage from heroes or magic. Simultaneous attacks from enemies that freeze your towers, shred your infantry, flying fast creatures, unstoppable runners, minibosses with 4k health – all while the main boss permanently destroys your towers for a ransom of 220 (!!!) gold… Hello, game industry, did you even test this?!

Paid DLCs: no desire to buy two expansions at the price of the base game. Sorry, i`m not sorry. 

Just like the Terminator franchise really only had two movies *wink-wink*, Kingdom Rush as a series ended with the second game. A shame. But I have no desire to mess with this casual trash any further.

P.S. A few numbers from my region to illustrate the logic behind milking through DLCs: the game Kingdom Rush Vengeance was released in 2020, with paid DLCs coming out in 2023 and 2024. During the last sale, the discount on them was 10%, or 12.5% if bought as a bundle. It was October 2025...

I did not expect this game to be a short one and too much DLCs to be bought. Sad to say it degraded as it progresses and I regeret buying this game on Steam.

This game was unplayable for me.  It started in the wrong screen size with the 'options' button somewhere off screen.  30 minutes of browsing forums, the internet, and seeing Dev's suggestions for this common problem mostly involved going to %appdata% and scrolling through the Explorer tree then opening settings files and editing them in notepad, which didn't work by the way, leads me to believe they may be experts at graphics and gameplay and god knows what else but they can't figure out a way to fix a common problem without asking us to code for them.  Angrily refunded.
This game is so friggin boring, I can't bring myself to play it. I used to loved the past entries so it figured out I might like this one as well.

After a couple weeks of trying to figure out how to even launch the game, I finally started the first mission and was immediately thrown off. The tutorial one of those disgusting and annoying auto-playing mobile game tutorials, where the game only lets you do and click what it tells you to. Kingdom Rush has never been like that. This is a series notorious for being unforgivingly difficult. That's part of its charm, contrasting a cartoony style with brutal difficulty. Starting off by insulting my intelligence and assuming I'm some drooling mobile gamer? GTFO with that nonsense.

Maybe the game is actually good. I won't know. I can get past the insult of the tutorial. What I can't get past is how this game destroys my computer. Literally every time I've opened it, even when it wouldn't actually play (because it launches in 4K, WHY?), it would do something nasty to my graphics drivers. My taskbar would float behind windows, forcing me to restart Explorer. It would cause Wallpaper Engine to hitch every few minutes. It would cause other games play to have frame drops and driver crashes. Some games would even crash so hard, my entire computer would lock up for up to a minute. Then I would restart my computer, and everything is back to normal.

I don't know how they could screw this up so badly.

DLC in a 20-dollar mobile game

Maybe the game is actually good. I won't know. I can get past the insult of the tutorial. What I can't get past is how this game destroys my computer. Literally every time I've opened it, even when it wouldn't actually play (because it launches in 4K, WHY?), it would do something nasty to my graphics drivers. My taskbar would float behind windows, forcing me to restart Explorer. It would cause Wallpaper Engine to hitch every few minutes. It would cause other games play to have frame drops and driver crashes. Some games would even crash so hard, my entire computer would lock up for up to a minute. Then I would restart my computer, and everything is back to normal.

I don't know how they could screw this up so badly.

DLC in a 20-dollar mobile game

Balance gets worse every time they make a new game, damn
Terrible Game

I’ve been thinking for a long time about what rating to give this game… I decided to replay the levels from the free DLCs, and the answer came by itself: I’m tired of this unoptimized, untested mess disguised at hard and insane difficulty.

As a fan of the first two games - Kingdom Rush (630 hours played) and Kingdom Rush Frontiers (430 hours played), I can say with confidence – this is a poorly balanced casual grind-fest designed to milk players with paid DLC. I didn’t want to buy the fifth part, but it was gifted to me :)

Let’s quickly go over the main aspects: graphics are nice, the artists do their job well. Sound and music are fine. Controls are smooth and responsive. But gameplay, balance, and replayability – that’s where everything falls apart.

Main game: you basically have two ways of playing.
--- The hard way: set the game to high difficulty, clear each mission, then heroic and iron challenges, level up all heroes. You sweat, you replay levels, sometimes even have fun, and once the boomerang tower that generates gold appears, the game becomes way too easy.
--- The easy way: even on high difficulty you just yawn through the whole campaign, maybe do heroic and iron if you feel like it (or skip them entirely). Boring.

Free DLCs: These are something beyond good and evil, especially the swamp levels. Monsters that make some towers completely useless. Bugs where tanky enemies don’t take damage from heroes or magic. Simultaneous attacks from enemies that freeze your towers, shred your infantry, flying fast creatures, unstoppable runners, minibosses with 4k health – all while the main boss permanently destroys your towers for a ransom of 220 (!!!) gold… Hello, game industry, did you even test this?!

Paid DLCs: no desire to buy two expansions at the price of the base game. Sorry, i`m not sorry. 

Just like the Terminator franchise really only had two movies *wink-wink*, Kingdom Rush as a series ended with the second game. A shame. But I have no desire to mess with this casual trash any further.

P.S. A few numbers from my region to illustrate the logic behind milking through DLCs: the game Kingdom Rush Vengeance was released in 2020, with paid DLCs coming out in 2023 and 2024. During the last sale, the discount on them was 10%, or 12.5% if bought as a bundle. It was October 2025...

As someone who grew up with Kingdom rush from a young young age playing it as a flash game with my grandad. this game is simply not the same, I like the core concept but there are a few issue that ruin that kind of vibe the old kingdom rush gave. 

1. there arent really unique enemies per zone that force you to consider what Towers youre using, you can kind of just spam the same few towers and win the game easily. you dont have to go into a mission and carefully consider what towers youre bringing which to a degree I get because it would be boring to go in a mission just to learn the monsters on the waves and then restart with the right tower but this is why the first kingdom rush games were so good. The base towers all served a role and they could specialise on the go allowing you to assess the situation and make the right choice.

2. Towers lack much personality, unlike older games where every tower had multiple specialisations making it fun to mess around and find out which build for that tower is the best, the towers in this game are static with the same upgrades every time and I understand this game is trying to have many new towers instead of a few with many specialisations but it just makes all the towers boring. there is no variety, you can only do one thing with those towers,
I did not expect this game to be a short one and too much DLCs to be bought. Sad to say it degraded as it progresses and I regeret buying this game on Steam.

Kinda disappointed on a number of levels. This isn't the first version of this game I've played, and I have played quite a few TD games. 

 There's a lot of variety on towers and champions to play and that's cool. But some are just wildly stronger than others. It means you can just spam one tower on basically every level and win. 

Same with heroes. Ranged are just massively stronger than melee, and flying is even stronger than that since they don't die. Also Melee is handicapped since it's much harder for them to gain XP. 

So now you have a very clear meta on how to win and it's boring. Now let's add to that: there's no speed controls in the game so it's stuck going very slow. Also you can't window the screen, so if you want to alt+tab to something else while you wait, you can't. 

Lastly, and maybe this is only a thing for me: You can't just escape> quit. You are forced to go to the main menu and then quit. It's 2025, it's not hard to code this. Esc> exit game on every game forever, this is a cardinal rule of gaming. 

This is one of those mobile time wasters, whatever. Not worth the price on PC, that's for sure. Maybe if it goes on sale for $5.

Other reviews said it better so I'll keep it short. Its a 6/10 not worth the money. It lacks content and innovation and is no better then the previous games, arguably worse in multiple aspects. Its DLC's do not fix the core problems with its design, gold based difficulty, bosses instantly destroying or disabling towers, etc. They do add more content which this game is notably lacking but also increase the price which is already too high. If you want to play Kingdom Rush the previous four games are better, only play this one if you liked the previous games and want more of the series and even then only get this game with its DLC's and on sale. If Steam had a neutral review id select it over negative.

This game was unplayable for me.  It started in the wrong screen size with the 'options' button somewhere off screen.  30 minutes of browsing forums, the internet, and seeing Dev's suggestions for this common problem mostly involved going to %appdata% and scrolling through the Explorer tree then opening settings files and editing them in notepad, which didn't work by the way, leads me to believe they may be experts at graphics and gameplay and god knows what else but they can't figure out a way to fix a common problem without asking us to code for them.  Angrily refunded.
This game is so friggin boring, I can't bring myself to play it. I used to loved the past entries so it figured out I might like this one as well.

After a couple weeks of trying to figure out how to even launch the game, I finally started the first mission and was immediately thrown off. The tutorial one of those disgusting and annoying auto-playing mobile game tutorials, where the game only lets you do and click what it tells you to. Kingdom Rush has never been like that. This is a series notorious for being unforgivingly difficult. That's part of its charm, contrasting a cartoony style with brutal difficulty. Starting off by insulting my intelligence and assuming I'm some drooling mobile gamer? GTFO with that nonsense.

Maybe the game is actually good. I won't know. I can get past the insult of the tutorial. What I can't get past is how this game destroys my computer. Literally every time I've opened it, even when it wouldn't actually play (because it launches in 4K, WHY?), it would do something nasty to my graphics drivers. My taskbar would float behind windows, forcing me to restart Explorer. It would cause Wallpaper Engine to hitch every few minutes. It would cause other games play to have frame drops and driver crashes. Some games would even crash so hard, my entire computer would lock up for up to a minute. Then I would restart my computer, and everything is back to normal.

I don't know how they could screw this up so badly.

As someone who grew up with Kingdom rush from a young young age playing it as a flash game with my grandad. this game is simply not the same, I like the core concept but there are a few issue that ruin that kind of vibe the old kingdom rush gave. 

1. there arent really unique enemies per zone that force you to consider what Towers youre using, you can kind of just spam the same few towers and win the game easily. you dont have to go into a mission and carefully consider what towers youre bringing which to a degree I get because it would be boring to go in a mission just to learn the monsters on the waves and then restart with the right tower but this is why the first kingdom rush games were so good. The base towers all served a role and they could specialise on the go allowing you to assess the situation and make the right choice.

2. Towers lack much personality, unlike older games where every tower had multiple specialisations making it fun to mess around and find out which build for that tower is the best, the towers in this game are static with the same upgrades every time and I understand this game is trying to have many new towers instead of a few with many specialisations but it just makes all the towers boring. there is no variety, you can only do one thing with those towers,
I did not expect this game to be a short one and too much DLCs to be bought. Sad to say it degraded as it progresses and I regeret buying this game on Steam.

Kinda disappointed on a number of levels. This isn't the first version of this game I've played, and I have played quite a few TD games. 

 There's a lot of variety on towers and champions to play and that's cool. But some are just wildly stronger than others. It means you can just spam one tower on basically every level and win. 

Same with heroes. Ranged are just massively stronger than melee, and flying is even stronger than that since they don't die. Also Melee is handicapped since it's much harder for them to gain XP. 

So now you have a very clear meta on how to win and it's boring. Now let's add to that: there's no speed controls in the game so it's stuck going very slow. Also you can't window the screen, so if you want to alt+tab to something else while you wait, you can't. 

Lastly, and maybe this is only a thing for me: You can't just escape> quit. You are forced to go to the main menu and then quit. It's 2025, it's not hard to code this. Esc> exit game on every game forever, this is a cardinal rule of gaming. 

This is one of those mobile time wasters, whatever. Not worth the price on PC, that's for sure. Maybe if it goes on sale for $5.

Other reviews said it better so I'll keep it short. Its a 6/10 not worth the money. It lacks content and innovation and is no better then the previous games, arguably worse in multiple aspects. Its DLC's do not fix the core problems with its design, gold based difficulty, bosses instantly destroying or disabling towers, etc. They do add more content which this game is notably lacking but also increase the price which is already too high. If you want to play Kingdom Rush the previous four games are better, only play this one if you liked the previous games and want more of the series and even then only get this game with its DLC's and on sale. If Steam had a neutral review id select it over negative.

This game was unplayable for me.  It started in the wrong screen size with the 'options' button somewhere off screen.  30 minutes of browsing forums, the internet, and seeing Dev's suggestions for this common problem mostly involved going to %appdata% and scrolling through the Explorer tree then opening settings files and editing them in notepad, which didn't work by the way, leads me to believe they may be experts at graphics and gameplay and god knows what else but they can't figure out a way to fix a common problem without asking us to code for them.  Angrily refunded.
This game is so friggin boring, I can't bring myself to play it. I used to loved the past entries so it figured out I might like this one as well.

After a couple weeks of trying to figure out how to even launch the game, I finally started the first mission and was immediately thrown off. The tutorial one of those disgusting and annoying auto-playing mobile game tutorials, where the game only lets you do and click what it tells you to. Kingdom Rush has never been like that. This is a series notorious for being unforgivingly difficult. That's part of its charm, contrasting a cartoony style with brutal difficulty. Starting off by insulting my intelligence and assuming I'm some drooling mobile gamer? GTFO with that nonsense.

Maybe the game is actually good. I won't know. I can get past the insult of the tutorial. What I can't get past is how this game destroys my computer. Literally every time I've opened it, even when it wouldn't actually play (because it launches in 4K, WHY?), it would do something nasty to my graphics drivers. My taskbar would float behind windows, forcing me to restart Explorer. It would cause Wallpaper Engine to hitch every few minutes. It would cause other games play to have frame drops and driver crashes. Some games would even crash so hard, my entire computer would lock up for up to a minute. Then I would restart my computer, and everything is back to normal.

I don't know how they could screw this up so badly.

DLC in a 20-dollar mobile game

Balance gets worse every time they make a new game, damn
Terrible Game

I’ve been thinking for a long time about what rating to give this game… I decided to replay the levels from the free DLCs, and the answer came by itself: I’m tired of this unoptimized, untested mess disguised at hard and insane difficulty.

As a fan of the first two games - Kingdom Rush (630 hours played) and Kingdom Rush Frontiers (430 hours played), I can say with confidence – this is a poorly balanced casual grind-fest designed to milk players with paid DLC. I didn’t want to buy the fifth part, but it was gifted to me :)

Let’s quickly go over the main aspects: graphics are nice, the artists do their job well. Sound and music are fine. Controls are smooth and responsive. But gameplay, balance, and replayability – that’s where everything falls apart.

Main game: you basically have two ways of playing.
--- The hard way: set the game to high difficulty, clear each mission, then heroic and iron challenges, level up all heroes. You sweat, you replay levels, sometimes even have fun, and once the boomerang tower that generates gold appears, the game becomes way too easy.
--- The easy way: even on high difficulty you just yawn through the whole campaign, maybe do heroic and iron if you feel like it (or skip them entirely). Boring.

Free DLCs: These are something beyond good and evil, especially the swamp levels. Monsters that make some towers completely useless. Bugs where tanky enemies don’t take damage from heroes or magic. Simultaneous attacks from enemies that freeze your towers, shred your infantry, flying fast creatures, unstoppable runners, minibosses with 4k health – all while the main boss permanently destroys your towers for a ransom of 220 (!!!) gold… Hello, game industry, did you even test this?!

Paid DLCs: no desire to buy two expansions at the price of the base game. Sorry, i`m not sorry. 

Just like the Terminator franchise really only had two movies *wink-wink*, Kingdom Rush as a series ended with the second game. A shame. But I have no desire to mess with this casual trash any further.

P.S. A few numbers from my region to illustrate the logic behind milking through DLCs: the game Kingdom Rush Vengeance was released in 2020, with paid DLCs coming out in 2023 and 2024. During the last sale, the discount on them was 10%, or 12.5% if bought as a bundle. It was October 2025...
